# [brickster](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/)

## Overview

[brickster](https://github.com/databrickslabs/brickster) is the R
toolkit for Databricks, it includes:

- Wrappers for [Databricks
  API’s](https://docs.databricks.com/api/workspace/introduction)
  (e.g. [`db_cluster_list`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/db_cluster_list.html),
  [`db_volume_read`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/db_volume_read.html))

- Browser workspace assets via RStudio Connections Pane
  ([`open_workspace()`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/open_workspace.html))

- [DBI](https://dbi.r-dbi.org) + [dbplyr](https://dbplyr.tidyverse.org/)
  backend (no more ODBC installs!)

- Interactive Databricks REPL

## Quick Start

``` r
library(brickster)

# only requires `DATABRICKS_HOST` if using OAuth U2M
# first request will open browser window to login
Sys.setenv(DATABRICKS_HOST = "https://<workspace-prefix>.cloud.databricks.com")

# open RStudio/Positron connection pane to view Databricks resources
open_workspace()

# list all SQL warehouses
warehouses <- db_sql_warehouse_list()
```

Refer to the [“Connect to a Databricks
Workspace”](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/articles/setup-auth.html)
article for more details on getting authentication configured.

## Usage

### `{DBI}` Backend

``` r
library(brickster)
library(DBI)

# Connect to Databricks using DBI (assumes you followed quickstart to authenticate)
con <- dbConnect(
  DatabricksSQL(),
  warehouse_id = "<warehouse-id>"
)

# Standard {DBI} operations
tables <- dbListTables(con)
dbGetQuery(con, "SELECT * FROM samples.nyctaxi.trips LIMIT 5")

# Use with {dbplyr} for {dplyr} syntax
library(dplyr)
library(dbplyr)

nyc_taxi <- tbl(con, I("samples.nyctaxi.trips"))

result <- nyc_taxi |>
  filter(year(tpep_pickup_datetime) == 2016) |>
  group_by(pickup_zip) |>
  summarise(
    trip_count = n(),
    avg_fare = mean(fare_amount, na.rm = TRUE),
    avg_distance = mean(trip_distance, na.rm = TRUE)
  ) |>
  collect()
```

### Download & Upload to Volume

``` r
library(readr)
library(brickster)

# upload `data.csv` to a volume
local_file <- tempfile(fileext = ".csv")
write_csv(x = iris, file = local_file)
db_volume_write(
  path = "/Volumes/<catalog>/<schema>/<volume>/data.csv",
  file = local_file
)

# read `data.csv` from a volume and write to a file
downloaded_file <- tempfile(fileext = ".csv")
file <- db_volume_read(
  path = "/Volumes/<catalog>/<schema>/<volume>/data.csv",
  destination = downloaded_file
)
volume_csv <- read_csv(downloaded_file)
```

### Databricks REPL

Run commands against an existing interactive Databricks cluster, read
this
[article](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/articles/remote-repl.html)
for more details.

``` r
library(brickster)

# commands after this will run on the interactive cluster
# read the vignette for more details
db_repl(cluster_id = "<interactive_cluster_id>")
```

![](gifs/db_repl.gif)

## Installation

    install.packages("brickster")

### Development Version

    # install.packages("pak")
    pak::pak("databrickslabs/brickster")

## API Coverage

[brickster](https://github.com/databrickslabs/brickster) is very
deliberate with choosing what API’s are wrapped.
[brickster](https://github.com/databrickslabs/brickster) isn’t intended
to replace IaC tooling (e.g. [Terraform](#id_0)) or to be used for
account/workspace administration.

| API                                                                                     | Available | Version |
|-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|-----------|---------|
| [DBFS](https://docs.databricks.com/api/workspace/dbfs)                                  | Yes       | 2.0     |
| [Secrets](https://docs.databricks.com/api/workspace/secrets)                            | Yes       | 2.0     |
| [Repos](https://docs.databricks.com/api/workspace/repos)                                | Yes       | 2.0     |
| [mlflow Model Registry](https://docs.databricks.com/api/workspace/modelregistry)        | Yes       | 2.0     |
| [Clusters](https://docs.databricks.com/api/workspace/clusters)                          | Yes       | 2.0     |
| [Libraries](https://docs.databricks.com/api/workspace/libraries)                        | Yes       | 2.0     |
| [Workspace](https://docs.databricks.com/api/workspace/workspace)                        | Yes       | 2.0     |
| [Endpoints](https://docs.databricks.com/api/workspace/warehouses)                       | Yes       | 2.0     |
| [Query History](https://docs.databricks.com/api/workspace/queryhistory)                 | Yes       | 2.0     |
| [Jobs](https://docs.databricks.com/api/workspace/jobs)                                  | Yes       | 2.1     |
| [Volumes (Files)](https://docs.databricks.com/api/workspace/files)                      | Yes       | 2.0     |
| [SQL Statement Execution](https://docs.databricks.com/api/workspace/statementexecution) | Yes       | 2.0     |
| [REST 1.2 Commands](https://docs.databricks.com/api/workspace/commandexecution)         | Partially | 1.2     |
| [Unity Catalog - Tables](https://docs.databricks.com/api/workspace/tables)              | Yes       | 2.1     |
| [Unity Catalog - Volumes](https://docs.databricks.com/api/workspace/volumes)            | Yes       | 2.1     |
| [Unity Catalog](https://docs.databricks.com/api/workspace/catalogs)                     | Partially | 2.1     |

# Package index

## Authentication

- [`db_host()`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/db_host.md)
  : Generate/Fetch Databricks Host
- [`db_token()`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/db_token.md)
  : Fetch Databricks Token
- [`db_wsid()`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/db_wsid.md)
  : Fetch Databricks Workspace ID
- [`db_read_netrc()`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/db_read_netrc.md)
  : Read .netrc File
- [`db_current_user()`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/db_current_user.md)
  : Get Current User Info
- [`db_current_workspace_id()`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/db_current_workspace_id.md)
  : Detect Current Workspace ID
- [`db_current_cloud()`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/db_current_cloud.md)
  : Detect Current Workspaces Cloud

## Catalogs (Unity Catalog)

- [`db_uc_catalogs_get()`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/db_uc_catalogs_get.md)
  : Get Catalog (Unity Catalog)
- [`db_uc_catalogs_list()`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/db_uc_catalogs_list.md)
  : List Catalogs (Unity Catalog)

## Clusters

- [`db_cluster_action()`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/db_cluster_action.md)
  : Cluster Action Helper Function
- [`db_cluster_create()`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/db_cluster_create.md)
  : Create a Cluster
- [`db_cluster_delete()`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/db_cluster_delete.md)
  : Delete/Terminate a Cluster
- [`db_cluster_edit()`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/db_cluster_edit.md)
  : Edit a Cluster
- [`db_cluster_events()`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/db_cluster_events.md)
  : List Cluster Activity Events
- [`db_cluster_get()`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/db_cluster_get.md)
  : Get Details of a Cluster
- [`db_cluster_list()`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/db_cluster_list.md)
  : List Clusters
- [`db_cluster_list_node_types()`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/db_cluster_list_node_types.md)
  : List Available Cluster Node Types
- [`db_cluster_list_zones()`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/db_cluster_list_zones.md)
  : List Availability Zones (AWS Only)
- [`db_cluster_perm_delete()`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/db_cluster_perm_delete.md)
  : Permanently Delete a Cluster
- [`db_cluster_pin()`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/db_cluster_pin.md)
  : Pin a Cluster
- [`db_cluster_resize()`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/db_cluster_resize.md)
  : Resize a Cluster
- [`db_cluster_restart()`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/db_cluster_restart.md)
  : Restart a Cluster
- [`db_cluster_runtime_versions()`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/db_cluster_runtime_versions.md)
  : List Available Databricks Runtime Versions
- [`db_cluster_start()`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/db_cluster_start.md)
  : Start a Cluster
- [`db_cluster_terminate()`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/db_cluster_terminate.md)
  : Delete/Terminate a Cluster
- [`db_cluster_unpin()`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/db_cluster_unpin.md)
  : Unpin a Cluster
- [`get_and_start_cluster()`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/get_and_start_cluster.md)
  : Get and Start Cluster
- [`get_latest_dbr()`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/get_latest_dbr.md)
  : Get Latest Databricks Runtime (DBR)
- [`aws_attributes()`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/aws_attributes.md)
  : AWS Attributes
- [`gcp_attributes()`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/gcp_attributes.md)
  : GCP Attributes
- [`azure_attributes()`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/azure_attributes.md)
  : Azure Attributes
- [`cluster_autoscale()`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/cluster_autoscale.md)
  : Cluster Autoscale
- [`dbfs_storage_info()`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/dbfs_storage_info.md)
  : DBFS Storage Information
- [`file_storage_info()`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/file_storage_info.md)
  : File Storage Information
- [`s3_storage_info()`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/s3_storage_info.md)
  : S3 Storage Info
- [`cluster_log_conf()`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/cluster_log_conf.md)
  : Cluster Log Configuration
- [`docker_image()`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/docker_image.md)
  : Docker Image
- [`init_script_info()`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/init_script_info.md)
  : Init Script Info
- [`access_control_request()`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/access_control_request.md)
  : Access Control Request
- [`access_control_req_user()`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/access_control_req_user.md)
  : Access Control Request For User
- [`access_control_req_group()`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/access_control_req_group.md)
  : Access Control Request for Group

  : Get Status of Libraries on Cluster

  : Install Library on Cluster

  : Uninstall Library on Cluster

  : Wait for Libraries to Install on Databricks Cluster

  : Volume FileSystem Write

## Execution Contexts

- [`db_context_command_cancel()`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/db_context_command_cancel.md)
  : Cancel a Command
- [`db_context_command_parse()`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/db_context_command_parse.md)
  : Parse Command Results
- [`db_context_command_run()`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/db_context_command_run.md)
  : Run a Command
- [`db_context_command_run_and_wait()`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/db_context_command_run_and_wait.md)
  : Run a Command and Wait For Results
- [`db_context_command_status()`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/db_context_command_status.md)
  : Get Information About a Command
- [`db_context_create()`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/db_context_create.md)
  : Create an Execution Context
- [`db_context_destroy()`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/db_context_destroy.md)
  : Delete an Execution Context
- [`db_context_manager`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/db_context_manager.md)
  : Databricks Execution Context Manager (R6 Class)
- [`db_context_status()`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/db_context_status.md)
  : Get Information About an Execution Context

  : New Cluster

  : Cran Library (R)

  : Egg Library (Python)

  : Jar Library (Scala)
- [`lib_maven()`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/lib_maven.md)
  : Maven Library (Scala)
- [`lib_pypi()`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/lib_pypi.md)
  : PyPi Library (Python)
- [`lib_whl()`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/lib_whl.md)
  : Wheel Library (Python)
- [`email_notifications()`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/email_notifications.md)
  : Email Notifications
- [`cron_schedule()`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/cron_schedule.md)
  : Cron Schedule
- [`git_source()`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/git_source.md)
  : Git Source for Job Notebook Tasks

## Mlflow Model Registry

- [`db_mlflow_model_approve_transition_req()`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/db_mlflow_model_approve_transition_req.md)
  : Approve Model Version Stage Transition Request
- [`db_mlflow_model_delete_transition_req()`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/db_mlflow_model_delete_transition_req.md)
  : Delete a Model Version Stage Transition Request
- [`db_mlflow_model_open_transition_reqs()`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/db_mlflow_model_open_transition_reqs.md)
  : Get All Open Stage Transition Requests for the Model Version
- [`db_mlflow_model_reject_transition_req()`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/db_mlflow_model_reject_transition_req.md)
  : Reject Model Version Stage Transition Request
- [`db_mlflow_model_transition_req()`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/db_mlflow_model_transition_req.md)
  : Make a Model Version Stage Transition Request
- [`db_mlflow_model_transition_stage()`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/db_mlflow_model_transition_stage.md)
  : Transition a Model Version's Stage
- [`db_mlflow_model_version_comment()`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/db_mlflow_model_version_comment.md)
  : Make a Comment on a Model Version
- [`db_mlflow_model_version_comment_delete()`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/db_mlflow_model_version_comment_delete.md)
  : Delete a Comment on a Model Version
- [`db_mlflow_model_version_comment_edit()`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/db_mlflow_model_version_comment_edit.md)
  : Edit a Comment on a Model Version
- [`db_mlflow_registered_model_details()`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/db_mlflow_registered_model_details.md)
  : Get Registered Model Details

## R Library Management

- [`add_lib_path()`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/add_lib_path.md)
  : Add Library Path
- [`remove_lib_path()`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/remove_lib_path.md)
  : Remove Library Path

  : Test if object is of class EmbeddingVectorColumn

  : Get Global Warehouse Config

  : Process Inline SQL Query Results

  : Execute query with SQL Warehouse

  : List Warehouse Query History

  : Get and Start Warehouse

## DBI Backend

Standard DBI interface for Databricks SQL warehouses

- [`databricks-dbi`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/databricks-dbi.md)
  : DBI Interface for Databricks SQL Warehouses
- [`DatabricksSQL()`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/DatabricksSQL.md)
  : Create Databricks SQL Driver
- [`DatabricksDriver-class`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/DatabricksDriver-class.md)
  : DBI Driver for Databricks
- [`dbConnect(`*`<DatabricksDriver>`*`)`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/dbConnect-DatabricksDriver-method.md)
  : Connect to Databricks SQL Warehouse
- [`show(`*`<DatabricksDriver>`*`)`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/show-DatabricksDriver-method.md)
  : Show method for DatabricksDriver
- [`DatabricksConnection-class`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/DatabricksConnection-class.md)
  : DBI Connection for Databricks
- [`copy_to(`*`<DatabricksConnection>`*`)`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/copy_to.DatabricksConnection.md)
  : Copy data frame to Databricks as table or view
- [`dbAppendTable(`*`<DatabricksConnection>`*`,`*`<Id>`*`,`*`<data.frame>`*`)`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/dbAppendTable-DatabricksConnection-Id-data.frame-method.md)
  : Append rows to an existing Databricks table (Id method)
- [`dbAppendTable(`*`<DatabricksConnection>`*`,`*`<character>`*`,`*`<data.frame>`*`)`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/dbAppendTable-DatabricksConnection-character-data.frame-method.md)
  : Append rows to an existing Databricks table
- [`dbBegin(`*`<DatabricksConnection>`*`)`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/dbBegin-DatabricksConnection-method.md)
  : Begin transaction (not supported)
- [`dbCommit(`*`<DatabricksConnection>`*`)`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/dbCommit-DatabricksConnection-method.md)
  : Commit transaction (not supported)
- [`dbDataType(`*`<DatabricksConnection>`*`)`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/dbDataType-DatabricksConnection-method.md)
  : Map R data types to Databricks SQL types
- [`dbDisconnect(`*`<DatabricksConnection>`*`)`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/dbDisconnect-DatabricksConnection-method.md)
  : Disconnect from Databricks
- [`dbExecute(`*`<DatabricksConnection>`*`,`*`<character>`*`)`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/dbExecute-DatabricksConnection-character-method.md)
  : Execute statement on Databricks
- [`dbExistsTable(`*`<DatabricksConnection>`*`,`*`<AsIs>`*`)`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/dbExistsTable-DatabricksConnection-AsIs-method.md)
  : Check if table exists (AsIs method)
- [`dbExistsTable(`*`<DatabricksConnection>`*`,`*`<Id>`*`)`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/dbExistsTable-DatabricksConnection-Id-method.md)
  : Check if table exists (Id method)
- [`dbExistsTable(`*`<DatabricksConnection>`*`,`*`<character>`*`)`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/dbExistsTable-DatabricksConnection-character-method.md)
  : Check if table exists in Databricks
- [`dbGetInfo(`*`<DatabricksConnection>`*`)`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/dbGetInfo-DatabricksConnection-method.md)
  : Get connection information
- [`dbGetQuery(`*`<DatabricksConnection>`*`,`*`<character>`*`)`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/dbGetQuery-DatabricksConnection-character-method.md)
  : Execute SQL query and return results
- [`dbIsValid(`*`<DatabricksConnection>`*`)`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/dbIsValid-DatabricksConnection-method.md)
  : Check if connection is valid
- [`dbListFields(`*`<DatabricksConnection>`*`,`*`<AsIs>`*`)`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/dbListFields-DatabricksConnection-AsIs-method.md)
  : List column names of a Databricks table (AsIs method)
- [`dbListFields(`*`<DatabricksConnection>`*`,`*`<character>`*`)`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/dbListFields-DatabricksConnection-character-method.md)
  : List column names of a Databricks table
- [`dbListTables(`*`<DatabricksConnection>`*`)`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/dbListTables-DatabricksConnection-method.md)
  : List tables in Databricks catalog/schema
- [`dbQuoteIdentifier(`*`<DatabricksConnection>`*`,`*`<Id>`*`)`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/dbQuoteIdentifier-DatabricksConnection-Id-method.md)
  : Quote complex identifiers (schema.table)
- [`dbQuoteIdentifier(`*`<DatabricksConnection>`*`,`*`<SQL>`*`)`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/dbQuoteIdentifier-DatabricksConnection-SQL-method.md)
  : Quote SQL objects (passthrough)
- [`dbQuoteIdentifier(`*`<DatabricksConnection>`*`,`*`<character>`*`)`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/dbQuoteIdentifier-DatabricksConnection-character-method.md)
  : Quote identifiers for Databricks SQL
- [`dbRollback(`*`<DatabricksConnection>`*`)`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/dbRollback-DatabricksConnection-method.md)
  : Rollback transaction (not supported)
- [`dbSendQuery(`*`<DatabricksConnection>`*`,`*`<character>`*`)`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/dbSendQuery-DatabricksConnection-character-method.md)
  : Send query to Databricks (asynchronous)
- [`dbSendStatement(`*`<DatabricksConnection>`*`,`*`<character>`*`)`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/dbSendStatement-DatabricksConnection-character-method.md)
  : Send statement to Databricks
- [`dbWriteTable(`*`<DatabricksConnection>`*`,`*`<AsIs>`*`,`*`<data.frame>`*`)`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/dbWriteTable-DatabricksConnection-AsIs-data.frame-method.md)
  : Write table to Databricks (AsIs name signature)
- [`dbWriteTable(`*`<DatabricksConnection>`*`,`*`<Id>`*`,`*`<data.frame>`*`)`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/dbWriteTable-DatabricksConnection-Id-data.frame-method.md)
  : Write a data frame to Databricks table (Id method)
- [`dbWriteTable(`*`<DatabricksConnection>`*`,`*`<character>`*`,`*`<data.frame>`*`)`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/dbWriteTable-DatabricksConnection-character-data.frame-method.md)
  : Write a data frame to Databricks table
- [`db_collect(`*`<DatabricksConnection>`*`)`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/db_collect.DatabricksConnection.md)
  : Collect query results with proper progress timing for Databricks
- [`dbplyr_edition(`*`<DatabricksConnection>`*`)`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/dbplyr_edition.DatabricksConnection.md)
  : Declare dbplyr API version for Databricks connections
- [`show(`*`<DatabricksConnection>`*`)`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/show-DatabricksConnection-method.md)
  : Show method for DatabricksConnection
- [`sql_query_fields(`*`<DatabricksConnection>`*`)`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/sql_query_fields.DatabricksConnection.md)
  : SQL Query Fields for Databricks connections
- [`sql_query_save(`*`<DatabricksConnection>`*`)`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/sql_query_save.DatabricksConnection.md)
  : Create temporary views and tables in Databricks
- [`sql_table_analyze(`*`<DatabricksConnection>`*`)`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/sql_table_analyze.DatabricksConnection.md)
  : Handle table analysis for Databricks
- [`DatabricksResult-class`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/DatabricksResult-class.md)
  : DBI Result for Databricks
- [`dbClearResult(`*`<DatabricksResult>`*`)`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/dbClearResult-DatabricksResult-method.md)
  : Clear result set
- [`dbColumnInfo(`*`<DatabricksResult>`*`)`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/dbColumnInfo-DatabricksResult-method.md)
  : Get column information from result
- [`dbFetch(`*`<DatabricksResult>`*`)`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/dbFetch-DatabricksResult-method.md)
  : Fetch results from Databricks query
- [`dbGetRowCount(`*`<DatabricksResult>`*`)`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/dbGetRowCount-DatabricksResult-method.md)
  : Get number of rows fetched
- [`dbGetRowsAffected(`*`<DatabricksResult>`*`)`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/dbGetRowsAffected-DatabricksResult-method.md)
  : Get number of rows affected (not applicable for SELECT)
- [`dbGetStatement(`*`<DatabricksResult>`*`)`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/dbGetStatement-DatabricksResult-method.md)
  : Get SQL statement from result
- [`dbHasCompleted(`*`<DatabricksResult>`*`)`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/dbHasCompleted-DatabricksResult-method.md)
  : Check if query has completed
- [`show(`*`<DatabricksResult>`*`)`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/show-DatabricksResult-method.md)
  : Show method for DatabricksResult

## dbplyr Backend

dbplyr support for dplyr syntax with Databricks SQL

- [`databricks-dbplyr`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/databricks-dbplyr.md)
  : dbplyr Backend for Databricks SQL
- [`sql_query_fields(`*`<DatabricksConnection>`*`)`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/sql_query_fields.DatabricksConnection.md)
  : SQL Query Fields for Databricks connections
- [`sql_query_save(`*`<DatabricksConnection>`*`)`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/sql_query_save.DatabricksConnection.md)
  : Create temporary views and tables in Databricks
- [`sql_table_analyze(`*`<DatabricksConnection>`*`)`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/sql_table_analyze.DatabricksConnection.md)
  : Handle table analysis for Databricks
- [`sql_translation(`*`<DatabricksConnection>`*`)`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/sql_translation.DatabricksConnection.md)
  : SQL translation environment for Databricks SQL
- [`copy_to(`*`<DatabricksConnection>`*`)`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/copy_to.DatabricksConnection.md)
  : Copy data frame to Databricks as table or view
- [`db_collect(`*`<DatabricksConnection>`*`)`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/db_collect.DatabricksConnection.md)
  : Collect query results with proper progress timing for Databricks
- [`dbplyr_edition(`*`<DatabricksConnection>`*`)`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/dbplyr_edition.DatabricksConnection.md)
  : Declare dbplyr API version for Databricks connections

  : Get Object Status (Workspaces)

  : Import Notebook/Directory (Workspaces)

  : List Directory Contents (Workspaces)
- [`db_workspace_mkdirs()`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/db_workspace_mkdirs.md)
  : Make a Directory (Workspaces)

## Request Helpers

- [`db_request()`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/db_request.md)
  : Databricks Request Helper
- [`db_perform_request()`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/db_perform_request.md)
  : Perform Databricks API Request
- [`db_req_error_body()`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/db_req_error_body.md)
  : Propagate Databricks API Errors
- [`db_request_json()`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/db_request_json.md)
  : Generate Request JSON

## Low Level Helpers

- [`is.access_control_req_group()`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/is.access_control_req_group.md)
  : Test if object is of class AccessControlRequestForGroup
- [`is.access_control_req_user()`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/is.access_control_req_user.md)
  : Test if object is of class AccessControlRequestForUser
- [`is.access_control_request()`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/is.access_control_request.md)
  : Test if object is of class AccessControlRequest

  : Test if object is of class AwsAttributes

  : Test if object is of class AzureAttributes

  : Test if object is of class AutoScale

  : Test if object is of class ClusterLogConf

## Workspace Connection

- [`open_workspace()`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/open_workspace.md)
  : Connect to Databricks Workspace
- [`close_workspace()`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/close_workspace.md)
  : Close Databricks Workspace Connection

## REPL

- [`db_repl()`](https://databrickslabs.github.io/brickster/reference/db_repl.md)
  : Remote REPL to Databricks Cluster
